summary: This is an FBI news briefing from August 11, 2020, covering a wide range of national and international news. It includes a brief mention of documents being unsealed in the legal battle between Alan Dershowitz and Virginia Giuffre, an Epstein accuser, as part of a larger criminal investigations section. The document is primarily a daily news digest for FBI leadership.

persons.name: Alan Dershowitz
persons.context: Mentioned in the context of newly unsealed documents in his legal battle with Virginia Giuffre, an Epstein accuser. Dershowitz is seeking to subpoena Les Wexner for evidence.

persons.name: Virginia Giuffre
persons.context: Mentioned as an accuser of Jeffrey Epstein and as a party in a legal battle with Alan Dershowitz, where new documents have been unsealed.

persons.name: Les Wexner
persons.context: Mentioned as the former head of Victoria's Secret's parent company with ties to Jeffrey Epstein. Alan Dershowitz is seeking to subpoena him for evidence in his counter-suit against Giuffre.

persons.name: John Zeiger
persons.context: Mentioned as the attorney for Les Wexner. Alan Dershowitz is also asking that he be deposed and provide documents related to Wexner's relationship with Epstein accusers.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as a 'multi-millionaire pedophile' to whom Les Wexner had ties. The context is the legal battle involving his accuser, Virginia Giuffre.

connections.description: Engaged in a legal battle, with Dershowitz filing a counter-suit against Giuffre, an Epstein accuser.
Dershowitz is seeking to subpoena Wexner for evidence in his counter-suit against Giuffre, hoping to show Giuffre tried to extort Wexner.
The document states Wexner had ties to Jeffrey Epstein.
Giuffre is identified as an accuser of Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Documents Unsealed in Dershowitz-Giuffre Case
events.description: New documents were unsealed in the legal battle between Harvard law professor Alan Dershowitz and Jeffrey Epstein accuser Virginia Giuffre. The documents relate to Dershowitz's effort to subpoena billionaire Les Wexner.

keyFacts: New documents were unsealed on August 10, 2020, in the legal battle between Alan Dershowitz and Epstein accuser Virginia Giuffre.
The unsealed documents relate, in part, to Dershowitz's effort to subpoena and depose billionaire Les Wexner for evidence in his counter-suit against Giuffre.
Dershowitz hopes to show that Giuffre tried to extort Wexner, who had ties to Jeffrey Epstein.
Dershowitz is also asking that Wexner's attorney, John Zeiger, be deposed and provide documents related to Wexner's relationship with Epstein accusers.
The document is an FBI news briefing, indicating the FBI's monitoring of this case as part of its criminal investigations coverage.
